intro: Triphysaria hispida, commonly known as the hispid bladderpod, is an annual flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces elongated, hairy pods that contain several seeds. Triphysaria hispida is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
